decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while slowly gaining card advantage and controlling the pace of the game. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw spells, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish a dominant board presence. Utilizing powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Force of Will, and Dig Through Time, the deck can efficiently answer threats and protect its own win conditions. By carefully managing resources and making efficient plays, the deck aims to grind out victories in a slow and methodical manner.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong board presence. The deck utilizes powerful counter spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to control the game tempo. It also includes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push to deal with threats. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters adds additional ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to ensure a steady stream of resources.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of card advantage, counterspells, and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It also includes efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog to pressure the opponent while maintaining control over the board. The deck features a mix of powerful Vintage restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk, along with mana acceleration from artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and slowly grind out a win through superior card advantage and resource management.

The deck focuses on assembling a fast and aggressive artifact-based strategy, utilizing cards like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb to generate mana quickly. The key cards in the deck are The One Ring, Manifold Key, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, allowing for explosive plays and efficient mana ramp. Additionally, cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void disrupt opponent's strategies, while Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge provide additional utility and card advantage. By combining powerful artifacts and efficient mana sources, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a strong aggro-mud strategy.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through efficient removal, counter spells, and disruptive creatures. It utilizes powerful Vintage cards like Ancestral Recall, Black Lotus, and Force of Will to maintain board control and disrupt opponents' strategies. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion providing additional value and recursion. The deck also includes cards like Demonic Tutor and Treasure Cruise for card advantage and consistency. Overall, the goal is to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of disruption and card advantage.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies using artifact creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge to disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate additional value. The inclusion of cards like Time Vault and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide alternative win conditions if needed. The deck aims to control the board while pressuring the opponent, taking advantage of powerful artifact synergy and efficient mana sources to gain a strategic advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive abilities. By utilizing cards like Grim Monolith, Scrawling Crawler, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, the deck aims to create a fast and aggressive board presence while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere. The inclusion of cards like Time Vault and Karn, the Great Creator also allows for game-ending combos and additional utility. The deck looks to quickly establish dominance and close out the game before the opponent can react.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with artifact accelerants and producing aggressive threats to overwhelm the opponent. It aims to lock down the opponent with disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere while utilizing powerful artifacts like Mystic Forge and Time Vault to generate card advantage and take extra turns. The deck also contains a strong artifact synergistic theme with cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Urza's Saga to further boost its aggressive strategy and close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana and playing powerful artifacts to disrupt your opponent's strategy. It utilizes powerful mana accelerants like Moxen and Grim Monolith, alongside disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere. The deck?s key win condition is to assemble the Time Vault + Voltaic Key combo to take extra turns and overwhelm the opponent. It also includes cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge to further control the board and maintain advantage. The deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and close out the game before the opponent can effectively respond.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifact ramp and fast mana to power out powerful threats such as Karn, the Great Creator, and Mystic Forge. The key strategy is to lock down opponents with cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void while utilizing cards like Time Vault and The One Ring to generate infinite turns and overwhelming advantages. The deck combines aggro and artifact synergies to quickly disrupt opponents and establish board control, ensuring a fast and aggressive victory.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, while using disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade. Each card is carefully selected to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control over the board. The inclusion of cards like Black Lotus, Mox Sapphire, and Demonic Tutor allows for powerful plays and card advantage. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and disruptive lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine to stay ahead of the opponent.

This deck focuses on using the Paradoxical Outcome card to generate a large amount of card advantage and mana, allowing for explosive plays and combo potential. By returning multiple artifacts to hand and drawing a significant amount of cards, the deck aims to set up powerful win conditions like Brain Freeze or Thundertap Trainer. With a strong artifact and mana base, along with disruptive spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares for protection, the deck aims to control the game until it can combo off and win in a single turn.

This deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements and the Gifts Ungiven card to tutor and strategically put cards into the graveyard for later use. It includes a mix of fast mana acceleration, countermagic, disruption, and card draw to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of resiliency and flexibility to the deck's game plan. The goal is to control the game state, set up powerful combo plays, and outvalue the opponent through carefully curated card selection and resource management.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures to maintain control of the game. With powerful cards like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Psychic Frog, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually gaining card advantage and eventually closing out the game with powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds extra versatility and value, allowing for additional recursion and resiliency against aggressive strategies.

This deck focuses on using control elements and the Gifts Ungiven card to search for key combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes powerful spells and mana acceleration to quickly set up win conditions, all while utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for additional consistency. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents through efficient card advantage and disruption, ultimately leading to a strategic advantage in the game. With a mix of counter spells, card draw, and mana ramp, the deck seeks to control the flow of the game and emerge victorious.

This deck focuses on using powerful tutors and control elements to effectively utilize the graveyard as a resource, primarily through the use of Gifts Ungiven. The deck aims to maximize value and card advantage by efficiently cycling through the deck, disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal, and ultimately winning through a combo involving cards like Brain Freeze and Underworld Breach. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional recursion and resilience to the deck's strategy.
